intro: Borreria neesiana, commonly known as the Mexican borage, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. Its leaves are typically alternate, simple, and have a slightly serrated edge. Borreria neesiana is often found in dry, open habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
